subject: Career
title: The Network Audit: Mapping Your Gaps
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Network Audit: Mapping Your Gaps.

hook.text: She drew her network on paper. Everyone was in her department. Her entire network was one color.

buildup.text: A network audit maps your connections by type: industry, function, seniority, and geography.

discovery.text: Gaps in your network are blind spots in your career. No finance contacts means no financial perspective.

twist.text: Most people's networks are 80% similar to themselves. Homophily â€” we connect with people like us.

climax.text: Audit annually: list your top 20 contacts. Map them by category. Fill the gaps intentionally.

punchline.text: You can't see what your network can't show you. Map the gaps.

quiz.question: What is homophily in networking?
options: The tendency to connect with people similar to ourselves
